meanings.definition: A person who engages in the act of begging or soliciting for money or goods.
meanings.sent1: The dorsers on the street were asking for help.
meanings.sent2: The city had many dorsers seeking assistance.
meanings.sent3: The group of dorsers had a competition to see who could collect the most donations.
meanings.sent4: Her little brother was a dorsers, always asking for treats.
meanings.sent5: The image of the dorsers with their hands outstretched stayed in her mind.

meanings.definition: A bag or pouch worn over the shoulder for carrying items.
meanings.sent1: She placed her books in the dorsers before heading to class.
meanings.sent2: The hiker's dorsers held all the necessary supplies for the journey.
meanings.sent3: The fashionable dorsers matched her outfit perfectly.
meanings.sent4: His trusty dorsers never failed to carry all his tools.
meanings.sent5: The leather dorsers had intricate designs etched into them.
